column4: Does anyone know how to uninstall a package with a broken pre-uninst script?
pre-removal rather
can you paste the entire error on pastebin?
http://dpaste.com/11213/
It didn't install completely because of broken pre-inst scripts. I just want to get rid of it now
try this: dpkg -r reportbug    do you get the same error?
Same error
ok, now try: dpkg -r --force-all reportbug
How risky is that? This is my gateway and it's late...
Screw it, I'll do it anyway
it's only reportbug, it's not vital to the running system
I was more worried about 'forcing' and breaking something
no need, since apt is just a front-end to dpkg
Same error
still looking...
Don't worry about it too much. I'll look through the install scripts tomorrow to try and pin down the error
cd /var/lib/dpkg/info && ls -l reportbug*
ok
Yeah I will debug it tomorrow (were you just pointing me to the prerm scripts?)
yeah, that's all of the scripts and files for it, actually
Okay, thanks for the help
you're welcome, good luck
